WRITING.TITLE: The Bacon Tree
WRITING.TEXT:
Two Mexicans are stuck in the desert after crossing into the United States , wandering aimlessly and starving. They are about to just lie down and wait for death, when all of a sudden Luis says.........
"Hey Pepe, do you smell what I smell. Ees bacon, I theenk."
"Si, Luis, eet sure smells like bacon. "
With renewed hope they struggle up the next sand dune, there, in the distance, is a tree loaded with bacon.
There's raw bacon, there's fried bacon, back bacon, double smoked bacon ... Every imaginable kind of cured pork.
"Pepe, Pepe, we ees saved. Ees a bacon tree."
"Luis, maybe ees a meerage? We ees in the desert don't forget."
"Pepe, since when deed you ever hear of a meerage that smell like bacon...ees no meerage, ees a bacon tree."
And with that, Luis staggers towards the tree. He gets to within 5 metres, Pepe crawling close behind, when suddenly a machine gun opens up, and Luis drops like a wet sock. Mortally wounded, he warns Pepe with his dying breath,
"Pepe... Go back man, you was right, ees not a bacon tree!"
"Luis, Luis MI amigo... What ees it? "
"Pepe.. Ees not a bacon tree. Ees
Ees
Ees
Ees
Ees a ham bush...."

Basically harmless, unless you inhale it. The vast majority (by percentage) of uranium isotopes are alpha emitters. Alpha radiation won't even go close to penetrating your skin. Absolutely safe to handle without even wearing gloves.
The real danger is inhalation. Alpha radiation damages exposed, dividing cells. Inhalation of alpha emitters can be a serious problem. So you would want to wear the proper safety gear with regard to respiration when handling uranium.
Take, for instance, polonium-210 - the substance used to kill Alexander Litvinenko. Po-210 is basically harmless when in contact with your skin. But it emits so many alpha particles that it is absolutely deadly when inhaled or taken into the digestive tract, where nice, fresh cells are exposed to the alpha radiation.
I fucking cut that mofo off, the first chance I get.

Sorry - I meant normal as in engines without this energy recovery bullshit. I'd like to see turbocharged engines of ANY capacity - so long as they can compete with the same fuel allowance as everyone else. I simply do not understand the idea of limiting *specific* fuel consumption. No one has ever been able to explain it.
You have some allocated quantity of fuel (xyz kg) - why the fuck would you need to limit the *instantaneous* consumption of that fuel allowance? I really don't get it, at all. Every team must get to the finish with xyz kg. Why penalise them for using more than abc kg/hr at any point in the race? It makes absolutely no sense, whatsoever.
Look at the old 80s turbo cars - they were managing that specific rate in real time. The driver had to back off, and/or limit boost to finish the race, in many cases. Far, far more exciting than just saying you have 160 kg @ (max) 100 kg/h. I hate the FIA and their micromanaging bullshit.
Cheers mate. I'm really thinking about just dropping the cash on Steam. I'm sick of this shit - I just want to get past this bug. I might try one more pirate version. If it won't work, I'll go legit.

And don't get me started on that Red crap. My cat could piss a better bottle of spirits.
Cheers, mate. I thought it would be something like that.

I have dropped some serious coin on the more expensive bottles of Bundy and I honestly couldn't taste the difference between them and the standard stuff. Extremely disappointing but I learned my lesson - fuck Bundy. Only drink it if nothing else is available.

The .iso for the one that is bugged is in Program Files (x86). I was planning on putting the other one in Program files. Is that a good idea?

I remember when surround sound was the next big thing - and it really didn't do much for me. More annoying than anything, actually. I almost never watch movies and I sure as shit don't need it to listen to music in surround sound. Two speakers with a decent range is more than enough for me. I even question stereo sound for music. I have songs in mono and I really cant see a reason to find stereo versions. I can't tell the difference, apart from (for example) when they deliberately alternate a drum line from one side to the other - I find that quite annoying, to be honest.

I had that a lot as a kid. I would turn up to Camp Quality hoping to see a friend or two I had made at the last one or at the Childrens' Hospital. But so many times, the adults would tell me he's not coming - ever again. Sometimes I would see their names in the newsletters (this was the mid 80s) - and you can guess what that meant. I still remember them, 30 years on. I saw too many people fr the last time, even before I was 10.
